intro: Cayratia ruspolii, commonly known as the climbing cayratia, is a vine native to tropical regions of Asia and the Pacific. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its slender, twining stems and trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, fragrant flowers that are typically white or pale yellow, followed by small, round berries. It thrives in humid, shady environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its ornamental value and ease of cultivation, it is sometimes grown in gardens and greenhouses.
